column5: Since I began doing a bit of guiding 3 years ago it's been a really rewarding experience, but every now and then a day on the Lund is a little bit more special compared to others....  This past Tuesday I had two blind anglers aboard, Lawrence from the http://blindfishingboat.com/ and his buddy Dirk in the photo below is from Alabama and had high hopes of knocking Lake Trout off his "fish bucket list".  Watching these two fellas jig for lakers was a treat.  They needed very little assistance other than depth we were fishing and where the fish were in the column.  Dirk set into this one hard and played it like a pro.  Laying it down in front of him so he could "see" it with his hands may be the neatest things that has ever happened in my boat.     What a treat.  RJ
Love it!
That'd definitely be a rewarding day for you RJ and congrats to the angler too  Great stuff for sure !!
Great stuff RJ I guess the sayin holds true "even a blind man could catch a laker on the B.R." We have boated 22 in two morning fishes since opening.
Awesome!
What a special honor you had. Good on you.
Cool......what an awesome day for those guys....good job.....the smiles say it all!
THAT is a great story
Very cool great experience
Very cool!
Could only imagine the excitement!!!  .
That might be the coolest thing ive read on this board. Thanks for sharing
simply awesome. i cannot believe the high you got to share that experience. great karma should go your way.
Pure class...  Well done bud...
Well done , a great feel good story to start my day
thats an amazing thing to do for those guys rob !!!! awesome.....
very nice , your job was extra special that day for sure ....
Great stuff RJ, wonderful story you'll remember for many years to come!!
Fantastic!
Thanks folks, glad you enjoyed this!  RJ
absolutely amazing.  met Lawrence and his dog a few times both at shows and on the water. Pretty amazing.
x2
